Pilgrim’s 20-year license renewal backed

The staff at the Nuclear Regulatory Commission has recommended that commissioners vote to renew the license of the Pilgrim Nuclear Power Station in Plymouth.
Opinion | Lawrence Harmon

No-innovation district

If Boston really wants entrepreneurs, it should ease up on street vendors.

Harvard panel pushes benefits of free journals

An advisory council called the rising price of academic journals “fiscally unsustainable” and urged faculty to submit their work to “open access” online journals.

Redman, Mehldau are a perfect pair

A one-time gig as a duo became an ongoing project for jazz saxophonist Joshua Redman and pianist Brad Mehldau.

Gas stations sue over supply

Operators of BP gas stations have filed a lawsuit against gasoline supplier Green Valley Oil LLC after weeks without deliveries caused many to run out of gas.
Opinion | Renée Loth

Is the Nobel committee off its mission?

According to critics, Alfred Nobel intended the prize to recognize leaders working specifically on disarmament.

Mullet lost for a good cause

Wellesley High athlete Isaac Blake shaved head to raise funds in honor of a coach with Lou Gehrig’s disease.
